rum.title: Real User Monitoring
rum.aboutRUMTitle: Discover Real User Monitoring to Enhance Your User Experience
rum.aboutRUMMessage: Real User Monitoring allows you to track and analyze the performance of your website or application from the perspective of real users. This means understanding how actual users experience your site, where they face slowdowns, which pages they frequently use, and more.
rum.getStartedTitle: Get Started with Real User Monitoring

about.name: OpenObserve
about.os_libraries_msg: Built on the shoulders of giants. OpenObserve depends on many amazing open source libraries.
about.license_info_msg: You are using the Enterprise version governed by the enterprise license agreement.
about.license_info_os_msg: You are using the open source version under the
about.license_info_note: By using OpenObserve, you agree to comply with the applicable license terms.
about.feature_comparision_ent_msg: You're using OpenObserve Enterprise Edition with access to all advanced features listed below.
about.feature_comparision_plan_detail: Your plan: Enterprise Edition is free for up to 200 GB/day (~6 TB/month) of data ingestion.
about.feature_comparision_os_msg: You're currently using OpenObserve Open Source Edition. Upgrade to Enterprise Edition to unlock advanced features listed in the comparison table below.
about.feature_comparision_good_news: Good news: OpenObserve Enterprise Edition is completely free for up to 200 GB/day (~6 TB/month) of data ingestion.
about.feature_comparision_subtitle: Compare features across Open Source, Enterprise, and Cloud offerings
about.feature_extreme_performance: Extreme performance (100x improvement for many queries)
about.value_cost_enterprise: If self hosted, free for up to 200 GB/Day data ingested. Paid thereafter
about.no_license_installed_msg: No enterprise license is currently installed. Contact your administrator or request a new license.
about.community_msg: Join our vibrant community of developers and users building the future of observability.

dashboard.typeHolder: Describe the dashboard if you like

dashboard.trellisTooltip: This is only applicable when breakdown field is available. Add Breakdown Field to enable Trellis Layout
dashboard.trellisTimeShiftTooltip: Trellis is not supported for Time Shift Comparison (Comparison Against). Please remove Time Shift Comparison to enable Trellis Layout
dashboard.stepValueTooltip: The interval between datapoints, which must be returned from the range query.
dashboard.stepValueTooltipInfo: If not specified, the step value from Panel Configuration will be used.
dashboard.groupMultiYAxisTrellisTooltipEnabled: Enabled: Groups all Y-axis metrics for the same breakdown value into a single trellis chart
dashboard.groupMultiYAxisTrellisTooltipDisabled: Disabled: Creates separate trellis charts for each Y-axis metric and breakdown value combination
dashboard.groupMultiYAxisTrellisTooltipExample: Example: With Y-axis fields [CPU, Memory] and breakdown by [Server A, Server B]:
dashboard.groupMultiYAxisTrellisTooltipEnabledResu: • Enabled: 2 charts (Server A chart with CPU+Memory, Server B chart with CPU+Memory)
dashboard.groupMultiYAxisTrellisTooltipDisabledRes: • Disabled: 4 charts (Server A CPU, Server A Memory, Server B CPU, Server B Memory)
dashboard.groupMultiYAxisTrellisTooltipDescription: When you have multiple Y-axis fields and a breakdown field:
dashboard.topNTooltipTitle: This is only applicable when breakdown field is available
dashboard.topNTooltipDescription: Specify the number of Top N values to show when breakdown field is available.
dashboard.addOthersSeriesTooltip: Include an 'others' series for values outside the top results when using breakdown fields.
dashboard.noValueReplacementTooltip: What to display when a value is missing for time series
dashboard.yAxisMinTooltipTitle: Set the minimum value for the Y-axis.
dashboard.yAxisMinTooltipDescription: This defines the lowest point to display on the chart, but the axis may adjust lower if the data includes smaller values.
dashboard.yAxisMaxTooltipTitle: Set the maximum value for the Y-axis.
dashboard.yAxisMaxTooltipDescription: This defines the highest point to display on the chart, but the axis may adjust higher if the data includes larger values.
dashboard.comparisonAgainstTooltip: This feature allows you to compare data points from multiple queries over a selected time range. By adjusting the date or time, the system will retrieve corresponding data from different queries, enabling you to observe changes or differences between the selected time periods.
dashboard.markLinesTooltip: Show threshold lines on the chart.
dashboard.colorDefaultPaletteBySeriesSubLabel: Series with the same name will use the same color
dashboard.colorPaletteClassicSubLabel: A random color will be used for each series, regardless of its name
dashboard.colorSingleColorSubLabel: Set a specific color to all series
dashboard.drilldownTooltip: Navigate to a another dashboard or specified URL, carrying over all current variables for seamless data exploration.
dashboard.colorBySeriesTooltip: Apply colors to series for better visual distinction in charts. Customize colors for each series to enhance data visualization.

alerts.newFunctionAssociationMsg: Note: The function will be created, then you will be redirected to the previous form to associate the newly created function with the pipeline.

deduplication.title: Prevent Duplicate Alerts
deduplication.subtitle: Avoid sending the same alert multiple times by grouping similar alerts together.
deduplication.fingerprintFieldsHint: Select fields that make alerts similar (e.g., hostname, service). Leave empty to auto-detect based on your query.
deduplication.fingerprintFieldsTooltip: Choose which fields should match for alerts to be considered duplicates. For example, selecting 'hostname' means alerts from the same host will be grouped together. Different alert types (e.g., High CPU vs High Memory) are never grouped, even if they come from the same host. Leave empty for automatic detection based on your query type.
deduplication.timeWindowHint: Time period to group similar alerts. Leave empty to match your check interval.
deduplication.timeWindowTooltip: How long to remember recent alerts for grouping. If a similar alert happens within this time, it won't be sent again. Leave empty to use your alert's check interval.
deduplication.maxGroupSizeTooltip: Maximum number of deduplicated alerts to group together before sending a notification. Prevents overwhelming notifications when many similar alerts fire simultaneously.
deduplication.sendStrategyTooltip:
How to send grouped alerts:
• First with count: Send first alert with total count
• Summary: Send aggregated summary
• All: Send all alerts in one notification
deduplication.groupWaitTimeTooltip: Time to wait and collect similar alerts before sending a grouped notification. Allows batching of alerts that occur in quick succession.

summary.title: Summary
summary.configureAlert: Configure your alert to see a summary

plainEnglish.realTime: Alert me immediately when matching events occur in real-time
plainEnglish.butNoMoreThan: , but no more than once every
plainEnglish.defaultConditions: Alert me when the configured conditions are met

correlation.title: Alert Correlation
correlation.description: Configure how alerts are correlated and deduplicated across the organization. Alerts with matching fingerprint values will be grouped together.
correlation.semanticFieldNote: Note: Semantic field mappings are configured in the Service Identity tab.
correlation.enableOrgLevelTooltip: Enable deduplication and correlation features for all alerts in this organization
correlation.enableCrossAlertTooltip: Allow different alerts to deduplicate each other when they share the same fingerprint
correlation.fingerprintGroupsTooltip: Select which semantic groups to use for cross-alert fingerprinting. Alerts will be deduplicated if they share the same values for these dimensions.
correlation.fingerprintGroupsHint: Select at least one semantic group for cross-alert deduplication
correlation.fingerprintGroupsRequired: At least one semantic group must be selected
correlation.defaultWindowTooltip: In absence of semantic field match, alerts and data from given duration is considered related
correlation.defaultWindowDescription: In absence of semantic field match, alerts and data from given duration is considered related

stepCaptions.alertSetup: Set the stage for your alert
stepCaptions.compareWithPast: Compare current results with data from another time period
stepCaptions.alertSettings: Set your alert rules and choose how you'd like to be notified.
stepCaptions.deduplication: Avoid sending the same alert multiple times by grouping similar alerts together.
stepCaptions.advanced: Context variables, description, and row template

settings.deleteLogoMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this logo image? Click OK to delete.
settings.claimParserFunctionDescription: Select a function (VRL or JavaScript) to parse and transform SSO/LDAP claims into organization and role assignments
settings.claimParserFunctionHint: Choose a function from _meta org to parse SSO/LDAP claims (VRL or JavaScript)
settings.claimParserFunctionInputDescription: The function receives a JSON object containing claims mapped in Dex from your SSO/LDAP provider (e.g., email, name, groups, roles).
settings.claimParserFunctionOutputDescription: The function must return one of these formats:
settings.claimParserFunctionOutputExample1: • Success: Return an array of objects, each with 'org' (string) and 'role' (string) fields
settings.claimParserFunctionOutputExample2: • Deny: Return an object with 'deny' (boolean true) and 'reason' (string) fields
settings.noRecentErrors: No errors found in the last 24 hours
settings.ssoDomainRestrictionsDescription: Manage SSO claim parsing functions and control which domains and specific users are allowed to login using SSO providers
settings.domainRestrictionsSubsectionDescription: Control which domains and specific users are allowed to login using SSO providers
settings.domainHint: Enter domain names without the {at_sign} symbol
settings.allUsersAllowedMessage: All users with email addresses ending in {domain} will be allowed to login.
settings.invalidDomain: Please enter a valid domain name
settings.invalidEmail: Please enter a valid email address for this domain
settings.domainAlreadyExists: This domain has already been added
settings.confirmRemoveDomain: Are you sure you want to remove the domain '{domain}'?
settings.emailAlreadyExists: This email address has already been added
settings.confirmRemoveEmail: Are you sure you want to remove the email '{email}'?
settings.domainNeedsEmails: Domain '{domain}' must have at least one email address when not allowing all users
settings.noDomainMessage: No domains configured. Add domains above to restrict access.
settings.scrapeIntervalDescription: The scrape interval is the frequency, in seconds, at which the monitoring system collects metrics.
settings.maxSeriesPerQueryDescription: Maximum number of series that can be returned from a single PromQL query. Helps prevent UI freezing with large result sets. Leave empty to use system default (40,000).
settings.maxSeriesPerQueryTooltip: When a PromQL query like 'count(metric) by (label)' returns too many series, it can freeze the UI. This limit prevents that. Set to null for system default, or specify a value between 1,000 and 1,000,000.
settings.maxSeriesPerQueryValidation: Value must be between 1,000 and 1,000,000, or leave empty for default
settings.themeManagementDescription: Manage your organization's theme colors for both light and dark modes. These colors will be applied at the organization level.
settings.customLogoTextDescription: Custom logo text is used to change the default branding text displayed in the application.
settings.dragDropUpload: Drag & drop or click to upload
settings.customLogoLightDescription: Custom logo for light mode theme. This will be displayed when users are in light mode.
settings.customLogoDarkDescription: Custom logo for dark mode theme. This will be displayed when users are in dark mode.
settings.notAllowedAction: You are not allowed to perform this action.
settings.selectFileToUpload: Please select a file to upload.
settings.themeColorsResetSuccess: Theme colors reset to defaults and applied.
settings.textMaxCharacters: Text should be less than 100 characters.
settings.filesValidationFailed: {count} file(s) did not pass validation constraints

correlation.title: Correlation Settings
correlation.subtitle: Discover and manage service correlations across logs, traces, and metrics
correlation.discoveredServicesDescription: Services are automatically discovered from your telemetry data and grouped by their Fully Qualified Name (FQN) for correlation. Services sharing the same FQN are correlated together across logs, traces, and metrics.
correlation.noServicesDescription: Services will appear here as telemetry data is ingested with service identification attributes (like k8s-deployment, service name, etc.)
correlation.clickToViewSuggestions: Click to view correlation improvement suggestions
correlation.noSharedDimensions: No shared dimensions found across services
correlation.suggestionsDialogSubtitle: Services that could be correlated but are missing telemetry types
correlation.suggestionsInfoText: To enable full correlation, ensure your telemetry data includes consistent service identification attributes (like k8s-deployment, service name) across logs, traces, and metrics.
correlation.addTracingSuggestion: Add OpenTelemetry tracing instrumentation to enable full correlation
correlation.addLogsSuggestion: Configure log collection with matching service attributes
correlation.addMetricsSuggestion: Add metrics collection with matching service dimensions
correlation.serviceIdentityDescription: Configure how services are identified and correlated across logs, traces, and metrics. The Service FQN (Fully Qualified Name) is derived from workload dimensions in priority order.
correlation.howItWorksDescription: (Fully Qualified Name) is computed from your telemetry dimensions to uniquely identify and correlate services across different data sources.
correlation.priorityOrderDescription: Dimensions are checked in the order listed below. The first dimension with a value becomes the Service FQN.
correlation.exampleText: If you have both {dim1} and {dim2}, the FQN will be {value} because k8s-deployment has higher priority.
correlation.correlationDescription: Services with the same FQN are correlated, even if they have different {field} names.
correlation.fqnPriorityTooltip: Defines which dimensions are used to derive the Service FQN for correlation. First dimension with a value wins. Reorder to match your infrastructure.
correlation.fqnPriorityDescription: Drag to reorder or use arrow buttons. First matching dimension determines Service FQN.
correlation.noDimensionsConfigured: No dimensions configured. Click "Reset to Defaults" or add dimensions below.
correlation.addDimensionHint: Select a semantic group to add to the priority list.
correlation.noSemanticGroupsAvailable: No semantic groups available. Configure field mappings below first.
correlation.noSemanticGroupsConfigured: No semantic groups configured. Add field mappings below to define available dimensions.
correlation.configureSemanticGroupsFirst: Configure semantic field mappings below to define available dimensions for FQN priority.
correlation.semanticFieldTooltip: Maps different field names to semantic dimensions. For example, "deployment", "k8s.deployment.name", and "kube_deployment" all map to "k8s-deployment".
correlation.semanticFieldDescription: Configure how field names from your telemetry are mapped to semantic dimensions.
